data.event: Syrian army recaptures Qusayr
data.event_description: The Syrian army recaptures the key border town of Qusayr, in an assault led by fighters from Lebanon's Hezbollah.

data.event: Syrian Army accused of using chemical weapons
data.event_description: The Syrian Army is accused of killing more than 1,400 people, according to the United States, with chemical weapons in two rebel-held zones near Damascus.

data.event: Around a dozen rebel groups abandon the Syrian National Coalition
data.event_description: Around a dozen rebel groups abandon the Syrian National Coalition and reject its calls for a civil, democratic government. Seven of them later form their own alliance, the Islamic Front, intended to eventually create a state governed by Islamic law.

data.event: Syria destroys its chemical weapons production
data.event_description: Syria destroys its chemical weapons production equipment. The number of Syrian refugees registered with the UN tops 2 million.

data.event: Infighting among rebels spreads
data.event_description: Infighting among rebels spreads, pitting a variety of Islamists groups and moderate factions against the al-Qaida-breakaway calling itself Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant.

data.event: Peace talks don't gain traction
data.event_description: Two rounds of peace talks led by UN-Arab League mediator Lakhdar Brahimi in Geneva end without a breakthrough.

data.event: Rebels withdraw from Homs
data.event_description: Rebels withdraw from the old quarter of the central city of Homs in a significant symbolic victory for the government, putting the area that had been under siege for more than a year firmly in government hands.

data.event: Assad wins presidential election
data.event_description: Syrians in government areas vote in presidential elections. Assad, one of three candidates, overwhelmingly wins with 88.7 percent.

data.event: ISIS declares a self-styled Islamic caliphate
data.event_description: So called Islamic State group, as the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant is now known, seizes large parts of northern and western Iraq. In control of around a third of Syria and Iraq, it declares a self-styled Islamic caliphate.

data.event: ISIS takes control of Syria's largest oil-field
data.event_description: Islamic State group takes control of Syria's largest oil field, al-Omar, after fierce battles with the Nusra Front, al-Qaida's branch in Syria.

data.event: ISIS captures Tabqa military air base
data.event_description: Islamic State fighters capture Tabqa military air base in northeastern Syria, eliminating the last government-held outpost in Raqqa province.

data.event: US-led coalition begins airstrikes
data.event_description: US-led coalition begins airstrikes against Islamic State group targets in Syria.

data.event: ISIS begins attack on Kobani
data.event_description: IS begins offensive to take Syrian Kurdish town of Kobani, on the Turkish border.

data.event: Kurdish fighters take control of Kobani
data.event_description: With the help of US-led airstrikes, Kurdish fighters take control of Kobani.

data.event: ISIS overruns several Christian villages in eastern Hassakeh
data.event_description: IS overruns several Christian villages in Syria's eastern Hassakeh province, taking at least 220 Assyrian Christians hostage.

data.event: Idlib falls to Isalmist groups
data.event_description: The northwestern city of Idlib falls to Islamist groups led by al-Qaida’s affiliate, known as the Nusra Front.

data.event: Russia begins airstrikes
data.event_description: Russia begins launching airstrikes in Syria in support of Assad’s forces

data.event: Syria takes control of Bastion of Salma
data.event_description: Syrian Armed forces take control of the rebel Bastion of Salma in the Latakia Governorate

data.event: Turkey captures areas from ISIS
data.event_description: Turkish forces cross into northern Syria, capturing areas along the border from the Islamic State group

data.event: Syrian insurgents evacuate rebel-held eastern neighborhoods in Aleppo
data.event_description: Syrian insurgents evacuate rebel-held eastern neighborhoods of the northern city of Aleppo after a Russia-backed government offensive.

data.event: Nerve gas attacks kill 58 in Khan Sheikhoun
data.event_description: At least 58 people are killed in what doctors say could be a nerve gas attack on the town of Khan Sheikhoun in the rebel-held Idlib province. Witnesses say the attack was carried out by either Russian or Syrian Sukhoi jets. Moscow and Damascus deny responsibility.

data.event: U.S fires cruise missiles into Syria
data.event_description: The U.S. fires a barrage of cruise missiles into Syria in retaliation for the Khan Sheikhoun attack, in the first direct American assault on the Syrian government.

data.event: Rebels withdraw from Homs
data.event_description: Rebels withdraw from the last neighborhood they controlled in the city of Homs, once dubbed the capital of the revolution.
